comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: According to query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9E02EFD8133CE633A... (Nov 16, 1912) he was president of the Grand Trunk Railway. See en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_Trunk_Railway As the Wikipedia article notes, there was an extended and bitter battle over an extension of GTR to Providence, which had larger port facilities than New London, Connecticut. This NYT article and many others are about that dispute. The extension was never completed (also according to Wikipedia).
